paper_name: National Qualifications Computing Science Advanced Higher Specimen Question Paper

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Describe the sequence of pointer operations required to add a new node to the end of a double linked list.

subquestions.description: Identify the correct comparison condition required to implement a bubble sort algorithm on an array of records.

subquestions.description: Explain how a variable is used to control the loop boundaries and improve the efficiency of a bubble sort.

subquestions.description: Evaluate the efficiency of the bubble sort algorithm in terms of the number of comparisons required for a large dataset.

subquestions.description: Explain why direct manipulation of a private property is invalid according to the principle of encapsulation.

subquestions.description: Explain how the use of inheritance and subclasses reduces development time during program expansion.

subquestions.description: Design a UML class diagram for a subclass that includes private properties, public methods, and inheritance.

subquestions.description: Explain the limitations of accessing subclass methods when objects are stored within a superclass array using polymorphism.

subquestions.description: Implement code to find and display the unique identifier of an object containing a maximum attribute value within an array.

subquestions.description: Construct a Gantt chart to plan the scheduling of sequential and overlapping project stages.

subquestions.description: Explain why economic and technical feasibility studies are necessary before a project proceeds.

subquestions.description: Write code to declare a 2-D array using a specific data type and appropriate dimensions.

subquestions.description: Implement code to assign specific character values to multiple coordinates within a 2-D array.

subquestions.description: Describe the differences between usability testing conducted with prototypes and testing conducted with end-users on live solutions.
